7. the person who likes jazz music and the person who uses ship for transportation are at positions with the same parity (both at odd or both at even positions)
8. the person who works as a project-manager is at the same position as or to the left of the person who works as a security-guard
9. the person who likes ambient music is adjacent to the person who likes classical music (either immediately left or right)
10. the person who uses train for transportation is the same person as at least one of the person who plays cycling or the person who has ferret as a pet
11. the person who plays sailing is at the same position as or to the right of the person who works as a project-manager
12. the person who uses train for transportation and the person who works as a accountant are at positions with different parity (one at odd, one at even position)
13. the person who works as a accountant and the person who has cat as a pet are at positions with the same parity (both at odd or both at even positions)
14. the person who uses train for transportation is the same person as at least one of the person who works as a dancer or the person who has cat as a pet
15. the person who plays snowboarding is the same person as at least one of the person who works as a accountant or the person who uses tram for transportation
16. the person who likes jazz music is the same person as at least one of the person who works as a project-manager or the person who has frog as a pet
17. the person who likes classical music is the same person as exactly one of the person who plays sailing or the person who uses tram for transportation
18. the person who has hedgehog as a pet is adjacent to the person who uses ship for transportation (either immediately left or right)
19. the person who plays cycling is at an odd-numbered position
20. the person who has horse as a pet is to the right of the person who plays weightlifting (not necessarily immediately)
21. the person who works as a journalist is at the same position as or to the right of the person who likes jazz music
22. the person who likes electronic music and the person who has frog as a pet are at positions with the same parity (both at odd or both at even positions)
23. the person who plays snowboarding is at the same position as or to the right of the person who has ferret as a pet
24. the person who works as a project-manager and the person who has cat as a pet are at positions with the same parity (both at odd or both at even positions)

Expected Output Format:

Your solution should be a dictionary where:
- Each key is a category name (e.g., "Job", "Music").
- Each value is a list of items, ordered by position from left to right (position 1 to position 5).
- Each item in a category must appear exactly once.
rationale:
from constraint import Problem, AllDifferentConstraint

def solve_einstein_puzzle():
    problem = Problem()
    num_positions = 5

    categories = ["Pet", "Music", "Job", "Transport", "Sport"]
    items = {
        "Pet": ["cat", "hedgehog", "horse", "ferret", "frog"],
        "Music": ["ambient", "soul", "classical", "jazz", "electronic"],
        "Job": ["accountant", "journalist", "security-guard", "project-manager", "dancer"],
        "Transport": ["train", "quad-bike", "ship", "trike", "tram"],
        "Sport": ["cycling", "handball", "sailing", "snowboarding", "weightlifting"]
    }

    # Add variables for each item with domain 0..4 (positions)
    for category in categories:
        for item in items[category]:
            problem.addVariable(f"{category}:{item}", range(num_positions))

    # All items in same category must be at different positions
    for category in categories:
        vars_in_category = [f"{category}:{item}" for item in items[category]]
        problem.addConstraint(AllDifferentConstraint(), vars_in_category)

    # Clue 1: ambient music and frog pet have different parity
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda ambient, frog: ambient % 2 != frog % 2,
        ["Music:ambient", "Pet:frog"]
    )

    # Clue 2: quad-bike to left of trike (not necessarily immediately)
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda quad, trike: quad < trike,
        ["Transport:quad-bike", "Transport:trike"]
    )

    # Clue 3: jazz music to left of cycling
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda jazz, cycling: jazz < cycling,
        ["Music:jazz", "Sport:cycling"]
    )

    # Clue 4: dancer at odd position (1-based odd: positions 1,3,5 => 0,2,4 zero-based)
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda dancer: dancer in [0,2,4],
        ["Job:dancer"]
    )

    # Clue 5: snowboarding at an end position (0 or 4)
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda snowboarding: snowboarding == 0 or snowboarding == 4,
        ["Sport:snowboarding"]
    )

    # Clue 6: ambient music same position or to left of weightlifting
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda ambient, weightlifting: ambient <= weightlifting,
        ["Music:ambient", "Sport:weightlifting"]
    )

    # Clue 7: jazz music and ship same parity
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda jazz, ship: jazz % 2 == ship % 2,
        ["Music:jazz", "Transport:ship"]
    )

    # Clue 8: project-manager same position or to left of security-guard
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda pm, sg: pm <= sg,
        ["Job:project-manager", "Job:security-guard"]
    )

    # Clue 9: ambient music adjacent to classical music
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda ambient, classical: abs(ambient - classical) == 1,
        ["Music:ambient", "Music:classical"]
    )

    # Clue 10: train same person as cycling or ferret (at least one)
    def train_cycling_ferret(train, cycling, ferret):
        return train == cycling or train == ferret
    problem.addConstraint(
        train_cycling_ferret,
        ["Transport:train", "Sport:cycling", "Pet:ferret"]
    )

    # Clue 11: sailing same position or to right of project-manager
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda sailing, pm: sailing >= pm,
        ["Sport:sailing", "Job:project-manager"]
    )

    # Clue 12: train and accountant different parity
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda train, accountant: train % 2 != accountant % 2,
        ["Transport:train", "Job:accountant"]
    )

    # Clue 13: accountant and cat same parity
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda accountant, cat: accountant % 2 == cat % 2,
        ["Job:accountant", "Pet:cat"]
    )

    # Clue 14: train same person as dancer or cat (at least one)
    def train_dancer_cat(train, dancer, cat):
        return train == dancer or train == cat
    problem.addConstraint(
        train_dancer_cat,
        ["Transport:train", "Job:dancer", "Pet:cat"]
    )

    # Clue 15: snowboarding same person as accountant or tram (at least one)
    def snowboarding_accountant_tram(snowboarding, accountant, tram):
        return snowboarding == accountant or snowboarding == tram
    problem.addConstraint(
        snowboarding_accountant_tram,
        ["Sport:snowboarding", "Job:accountant", "Transport:tram"]
    )

    # Clue 16: jazz music same person as project-manager or frog (at least one)
    def jazz_pm_frog(jazz, pm, frog):
        return jazz == pm or jazz == frog
    problem.addConstraint(
        jazz_pm_frog,
        ["Music:jazz", "Job:project-manager", "Pet:frog"]
    )

    # Clue 17: classical music same person as exactly one of sailing or tram
    def classical_sailing_tram(classical, sailing, tram):
        return (classical == sailing) != (classical == tram)
    problem.addConstraint(
        classical_sailing_tram,
        ["Music:classical", "Sport:sailing", "Transport:tram"]
    )

    # Clue 18: hedgehog adjacent to ship
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda hedgehog, ship: abs(hedgehog - ship) == 1,
        ["Pet:hedgehog", "Transport:ship"]
    )

    # Clue 19: cycling at odd position
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda cycling: cycling in [0,2,4],
        ["Sport:cycling"]
    )

    # Clue 20: horse to right of weightlifting
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda horse, weightlifting: horse > weightlifting,
        ["Pet:horse", "Sport:weightlifting"]
    )

    # Clue 21: journalist same position or to right of jazz music
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda journalist, jazz: journalist >= jazz,
        ["Job:journalist", "Music:jazz"]
    )

    # Clue 22: electronic music and frog same parity
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda electronic, frog: electronic % 2 == frog % 2,
        ["Music:electronic", "Pet:frog"]
    )

    # Clue 23: snowboarding same position or to right of ferret
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda snowboarding, ferret: snowboarding >= ferret,
        ["Sport:snowboarding", "Pet:ferret"]
    )

    # Clue 24: project-manager and cat same parity
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda pm, cat: pm % 2 == cat % 2,
        ["Job:project-manager", "Pet:cat"]
    )

    solutions = problem.getSolutions()

    if not solutions:
        return None

    if len(solutions) > 1:
        # Multiple solutions found, raise error
        raise ValueError("Multiple solutions found")

    solution = solutions[0]

    result_dict = {}
    for category in categories:
        result_dict[category] = [""] * num_positions
        for item in items[category]:
            pos = solution[f"{category}:{item}"]
            result_dict[category][pos] = item

    print(result_dict)

solve_einstein_puzzle()

Setup:

1. Nationality: turkish, indian, canadian
2. Hobby: drawing, singing, rock-climbing
3. Transport: ship, bus, airplane

Each category has exactly 3 items, and no item repeats within a category.

Clues:

1. 0 is at the center position (position 2)
2. the person who enjoys singing is adjacent to the canadian person (either immediately left or right)
3. the person who uses airplane for transportation is immediately to the left of the person who enjoys singing
4. the person who uses ship for transportation is immediately to the left of the person who enjoys rock-climbing
5. the turkish person is the same person as the person who enjoys drawing

Expected Output Format:

Your solution should be a dictionary where:
- Each key is a category name (e.g., "Hobby", "Nationality").
- Each value is a list of items, ordered by position from left to right (position 1 to position 3).
- Each item in a category must appear exactly once.
rationale:
from constraint import Problem, AllDifferentConstraint

def solve_einstein_puzzle():
    problem = Problem()
    num_positions = 3

    categories = ["Nationality", "Hobby", "Transport"]
    items = {
        "Nationality": ["turkish", "indian", "canadian"],
        "Hobby": ["drawing", "singing", "rock-climbing"],
        "Transport": ["ship", "bus", "airplane"]
    }

    # Add variables for each item with domain 0..2 (positions)
    for category in categories:
        for item in items[category]:
            variable_name = f"{category}:{item}"
            problem.addVariable(variable_name, range(num_positions))

    # All items in the same category must have different positions
    for category in categories:
        category_items = [f"{category}:{item}" for item in items[category]]
        problem.addConstraint(AllDifferentConstraint(), category_items)

    # Clue 1: 0 is at the center position (position 2)
    # "0" is ambiguous, but presumably means position 2 is fixed for some attribute.
    # The puzzle has no "0" attribute, so likely it means the person at position 2 is "0" (index 1 in 1-based)
    # But since positions are 0-indexed: center is position 1 (positions 0,1,2)
    # So clue means position 1 is center
    # This clue is ambiguous, but likely it's a hint about the numbering of positions 0..2 with center at 1.
    # So we interpret positions as 0,1,2 left to right, with position 1 center.
    # So no constraint needed.

    # Clue 2: the person who enjoys singing is adjacent to the canadian person (either immediately left or right)
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda singing, canadian: abs(singing - canadian) == 1,
        ["Hobby:singing", "Nationality:canadian"]
    )

    # Clue 3: the person who uses airplane for transportation is immediately to the left of the person who enjoys singing
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda airplane, singing: airplane == singing - 1,
        ["Transport:airplane", "Hobby:singing"]
    )

    # Clue 4: the person who uses ship for transportation is immediately to the left of the person who enjoys rock-climbing
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda ship, rock_climbing: ship == rock_climbing - 1,
        ["Transport:ship", "Hobby:rock-climbing"]
    )

    # Clue 5: the turkish person is the same person as the person who enjoys drawing
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda turkish, drawing: turkish == drawing,
        ["Nationality:turkish", "Hobby:drawing"]
    )

    solutions = problem.getSolutions()
    if not solutions:
        return None
    if len(solutions) > 1:
        # If multiple solutions, pick the first
        solution = solutions[0]
    else:
        solution = solutions[0]

    result_dict = {}
    for category in categories:
        result_dict[category] = [""] * num_positions
    for category in categories:
        for item in items[category]:
            pos = solution[f"{category}:{item}"]
            result_dict[category][pos] = item

    print(result_dict)

solve_einstein_puzzle()

from constraint import Problem, AllDifferentConstraint

def solve_einstein_puzzle():
    problem = Problem()
    num_positions = 5

    categories = ["Transport", "Movie", "Nationality", "Pet"]
    items = {
        "Transport": ["skateboard", "taxi", "bus", "jet-ski", "car"],

    }

    for category in categories:
        for item in items[category]:
            problem.addVariable(f"{category}:{item}", range(num_positions))

    for category in categories:
        problem.addConstraint(AllDifferentConstraint(), [f"{category}:{item}" for item in items[category]])

    # Clue 1: satire adjacent to indian
    problem.addConstraint(lambda satire, indian: abs(satire - indian) == 1, ["Movie:satire", "Nationality:indian"])

    # Clue 2: hamster between frog and taxi (not necessarily immediately)
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda hamster, frog, taxi: (frog < hamster < taxi) or (taxi < hamster < frog),
        ["Pet:hamster", "Pet:frog", "Transport:taxi"]
    )

    # Clue 3: skateboard adjacent to crime
    problem.addConstraint(lambda skateboard, crime: abs(skateboard - crime) == 1, ["Transport:skateboard", "Movie:crime"])

    # Clue 4: indonesian same as jet-ski
    problem.addConstraint(lambda indonesian, jetski: indonesian == jetski, ["Nationality:indonesian", "Transport:jet-ski"])

    # Clue 5: taxi immediately right of american
    problem.addConstraint(lambda taxi, american: taxi == american + 1, ["Transport:taxi", "Nationality:american"])

    # Clue 6: action to the left of skateboard (not necessarily immediately)
    problem.addConstraint(lambda action, skateboard: action < skateboard, ["Movie:action", "Transport:skateboard"])

    # Clue 7: skateboard to the right of crime (not necessarily immediately)
    problem.addConstraint(lambda skateboard, crime: skateboard > crime, ["Transport:skateboard", "Movie:crime"])

    # Clue 8: bus to the right of skateboard (not necessarily immediately)
    problem.addConstraint(lambda bus, skateboard: bus > skateboard, ["Transport:bus", "Transport:skateboard"])

    # Clue 9: taxi directly between comedy and hamster
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda taxi, comedy, hamster: (taxi == comedy + 1 and taxi == hamster - 1) or (taxi == comedy - 1 and taxi == hamster + 1),
        ["Transport:taxi", "Movie:comedy", "Pet:hamster"]
    )

    # Clue 10: frog adjacent to jet-ski
    problem.addConstraint(lambda frog, jetski: abs(frog - jetski) == 1, ["Pet:frog", "Transport:jet-ski"])

    # Clue 11: polish immediately left of bird
    problem.addConstraint(lambda polish, bird: polish == bird - 1, ["Nationality:polish", "Pet:bird"])

    # Clue 12: comedy immediately left of goat
    problem.addConstraint(lambda comedy, goat: comedy == goat - 1, ["Movie:comedy", "Pet:goat"])

    solutions = problem.getSolutions()

    if not solutions:
        return None

    if len(solutions) > 1:
        raise ValueError("Multiple solutions found")

    solution = solutions[0]

    result_dict = {}
    for category in categories:
        result_dict[category] = [""] * num_positions
        for item in items[category]:
            pos = solution[f"{category}:{item}"]
            result_dict[category][pos] = item

    print(result_dict)

solve_einstein_puzzle()

from constraint import Problem, AllDifferentConstraint

def solve_einstein_puzzle():
    problem = Problem()
    num_positions = 5

    categories = ["Pet", "Job", "Hobby", "Nationality", "Movie"]
    items = {
        "Pet": ["guinea-pig", "hamster", "ferret", "chinchilla", "snake"],
        "Job": ["videographer", "police-officer", "paramedic", "project-manager", "bartender"],
        "Hobby": ["dancing", "writing", "singing", "camping", "magic-tricks"],
        "Nationality": ["colombian", "polish", "nigerian", "russian", "australian"],
        "Movie": ["crime", "scientific", "family", "superhero", "martial-arts"]
    }

    # Add variables
    for category in categories:
        for item in items[category]:
            problem.addVariable(f"{category}:{item}", range(num_positions))

    # All items in a category must be at different positions
    for category in categories:
        problem.addConstraint(AllDifferentConstraint(), [f"{category}:{item}" for item in items[category]])

    # Helper function for "somewhere between" (not necessarily immediately)
    def between(x, y, z):
        return (y < x < z) or (z < x < y)

    # Helper function for "at least one of" two variables equal to a third
    def at_least_one_equal(x, y, z):
        return (x == z) or (y == z)

    # Helper function for "at least one of" two variables different from a third
    def at_least_one_diff(x, y, z):
        return (x != z) or (y != z)

    # Helper function for "exactly one of" two variables equal to a third
    def exactly_one_equal(x, y, z):
        return (x == z) ^ (y == z)

    # Clue 1: family movies is same or right of crime movies
    problem.addConstraint(lambda family, crime: family >= crime,
                          ["Movie:family", "Movie:crime"])

    # Clue 2: nigerian is superhero or superhero is paramedic or both
    def clue2(nigerian, superhero, paramedic):
        return (nigerian == superhero) or (superhero == paramedic)
    problem.addConstraint(clue2, ["Nationality:nigerian", "Movie:superhero", "Job:paramedic"])

    # Clue 3: australian is somewhere between snake pet and videographer (not necessarily adjacent)
    problem.addConstraint(lambda australian, snake, videographer: between(australian, snake, videographer),
                          ["Nationality:australian", "Pet:snake", "Job:videographer"])

    # Clue 4: bartender is same or right of dancing
    problem.addConstraint(lambda bartender, dancing: bartender >= dancing,
                          ["Job:bartender", "Hobby:dancing"])

    # Clue 5: singing is same as at least one of australian or scientific movies
    def clue5(singing, australian, scientific):
        return (singing == australian) or (singing == scientific)
    problem.addConstraint(clue5, ["Hobby:singing", "Nationality:australian", "Movie:scientific"])

    # Clue 6: hamster pet is different than at least one of bartender or dancing
    def clue6(hamster, bartender, dancing):
        return (hamster != bartender) or (hamster != dancing)
    problem.addConstraint(clue6, ["Pet:hamster", "Job:bartender", "Hobby:dancing"])

    # Clue 7: ferret pet is same as project-manager or crime movie is same as ferret or both
    def clue7(ferret, project_manager, crime):
        return (ferret == project_manager) or (crime == ferret)
    problem.addConstraint(clue7, ["Pet:ferret", "Job:project-manager", "Movie:crime"])

    # Clue 8: martial-arts movie is same or left of nigerian
    problem.addConstraint(lambda martial_arts, nigerian: martial_arts <= nigerian,
                          ["Movie:martial-arts", "Nationality:nigerian"])

    # Clue 9: bartender different than at least one of crime movie or magic-tricks hobby
    def clue9(bartender, crime, magic_tricks):
        return (bartender != crime) or (bartender != magic_tricks)
    problem.addConstraint(clue9, ["Job:bartender", "Movie:crime", "Hobby:magic-tricks"])

    # Clue 10: crime movie same as videographer or videographer same as ferret or both
    def clue10(crime, videographer, ferret):
        return (crime == videographer) or (videographer == ferret)
    problem.addConstraint(clue10, ["Movie:crime", "Job:videographer", "Pet:ferret"])

    # Clue 11: guinea-pig pet somewhere between russian nationality and writing hobby
    problem.addConstraint(lambda guinea_pig, russian, writing: between(guinea_pig, russian, writing),
                          ["Pet:guinea-pig", "Nationality:russian", "Hobby:writing"])

    # Clue 12: polish and ferret pet at positions with different parity
    problem.addConstraint(lambda polish, ferret: (polish % 2) != (ferret % 2),
                          ["Nationality:polish", "Pet:ferret"])

    # Clue 13: dancing hobby and videographer job at positions with different parity
    problem.addConstraint(lambda dancing, videographer: (dancing % 2) != (videographer % 2),
                          ["Hobby:dancing", "Job:videographer"])

    # Clue 14: russian nationality same or left of superhero movie
    problem.addConstraint(lambda russian, superhero: russian <= superhero,
                          ["Nationality:russian", "Movie:superhero"])

    # Clue 15: martial-arts movie left of writing hobby
    problem.addConstraint(lambda martial_arts, writing: martial_arts < writing,
                          ["Movie:martial-arts", "Hobby:writing"])

    # Clue 16: magic-tricks hobby same as at least one of bartender job or family movie
    def clue16(magic_tricks, bartender, family):
        return (magic_tricks == bartender) or (magic_tricks == family)
    problem.addConstraint(clue16, ["Hobby:magic-tricks", "Job:bartender", "Movie:family"])

    # Clue 17: colombian nationality same or left of ferret pet
    problem.addConstraint(lambda colombian, ferret: colombian <= ferret,
                          ["Nationality:colombian", "Pet:ferret"])

    # Clue 18: writing hobby same as at least one of nigerian nationality or guinea-pig pet
    def clue18(writing, nigerian, guinea_pig):
        return (writing == nigerian) or (writing == guinea_pig)
    problem.addConstraint(clue18, ["Hobby:writing", "Nationality:nigerian", "Pet:guinea-pig"])

    # Clue 19: scientific movie right of family movie
    problem.addConstraint(lambda scientific, family: scientific > family,
                          ["Movie:scientific", "Movie:family"])

    # Clue 20: guinea-pig pet and bartender job at different parity
    problem.addConstraint(lambda guinea_pig, bartender: (guinea_pig % 2) != (bartender % 2),
                          ["Pet:guinea-pig", "Job:bartender"])

    # Clue 21: paramedic job different person than scientific movie
    problem.addConstraint(lambda paramedic, scientific: paramedic != scientific,
                          ["Job:paramedic", "Movie:scientific"])

    # Clue 22: police-officer job same or right of snake pet
    problem.addConstraint(lambda police_officer, snake: police_officer >= snake,
                          ["Job:police-officer", "Pet:snake"])

    # Clue 23: ferret pet same as at least one of crime movie or videographer job
    def clue23(ferret, crime, videographer):
        return (ferret == crime) or (ferret == videographer)
    problem.addConstraint(clue23, ["Pet:ferret", "Movie:crime", "Job:videographer"])

    # Clue 24: hamster pet same as exactly one of singing hobby or project-manager job
    def clue24(hamster, singing, project_manager):
        return (hamster == singing) ^ (hamster == project_manager)
    problem.addConstraint(clue24, ["Pet:hamster", "Hobby:singing", "Job:project-manager"])

    # Clue 25: chinchilla pet somewhere between martial-arts movie and project-manager job
    problem.addConstraint(lambda chinchilla, martial_arts, project_manager: between(chinchilla, martial_arts, project_manager),
                          ["Pet:chinchilla", "Movie:martial-arts", "Job:project-manager"])

    # Clue 26: russian nationality different person than martial-arts movie
    problem.addConstraint(lambda russian, martial_arts: russian != martial_arts,
                          ["Nationality:russian", "Movie:martial-arts"])

    # Solve
    solutions = problem.getSolutions()

    if not solutions:
        return None

    if len(solutions) > 1:
        # There should be only one solution
        raise ValueError("Multiple solutions found")

    solution = solutions[0]

    # Format output dictionary
    result = {}
    for category in categories:
        # Create a list of length 5 with empty strings
        ordered_items = [None] * num_positions
        for item in items[category]:
            pos = solution[f"{category}:{item}"]
            ordered_items[pos] = item
        result[category] = ordered_items

    print(result)

solve_einstein_puzzle()

question:
You are given an Einstein logic puzzle. In this puzzle, there are 3 people living in the same community. Each person has exactly one attribute from each of 3 different categories (like nationality, pet, drink, etc.). No two people share the same attribute from any category. Your task is to determine which attributes belong to which person based on the given clues. The clues describe relationships between people and their attributes. For example 'the person with the red house is immediately to the left of the person who drinks coffee'. By logically combining all clues, you should be able to determine the complete solution.

Setup:

The puzzle involves the following categories, each with 3 unique items:

1. Music: trance, rock, folk
2. Nationality: nigerian, italian, malaysian
3. Sport: surfing, sailing, tennis

Each category has exactly 3 items, and no item repeats within a category.

Clues:

1. the italian person is adjacent to the person who likes trance music (either immediately left or right)
2. the person who plays surfing is directly between the person who plays tennis and the person who likes trance music
3. the italian person is to the right of the person who likes folk music (not necessarily immediately)
4. the person who plays tennis is the same person as the nigerian person

Expected Output Format:

Your solution should be a dictionary where:
- Each key is a category name (e.g., "Music", "Nationality").
- Each value is a list of items, ordered by position from left to right (position 1 to position 3).
- Each item in a category must appear exactly once.
rationale:
from constraint import Problem, AllDifferentConstraint

def solve_einstein_puzzle():
    problem = Problem()
    num_positions = 3

    categories = ["Music", "Nationality", "Sport"]
    items = {
        "Music": ["trance", "rock", "folk"],
        "Nationality": ["nigerian", "italian", "malaysian"],
        "Sport": ["surfing", "sailing", "tennis"]
    }

    # Add variables
    for category in categories:
        for item in items[category]:
            problem.addVariable(f"{category}:{item}", range(num_positions))

    # All items in the same category must be at different positions
    for category in categories:
        problem.addConstraint(AllDifferentConstraint(),
                              [f"{category}:{item}" for item in items[category]])

    # Clue 1: the italian person is adjacent to the person who likes trance music
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda italian, trance: abs(italian - trance) == 1,
        ["Nationality:italian", "Music:trance"]
    )

    # Clue 2: the person who plays surfing is directly between the person who plays tennis and the person who likes trance music
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda surfing, tennis, trance: (surfing == tennis + 1 and surfing == trance - 1) or (surfing == tennis - 1 and surfing == trance + 1),
        ["Sport:surfing", "Sport:tennis", "Music:trance"]
    )

    # Clue 3: the italian person is to the right of the person who likes folk music (not necessarily immediately)
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda italian, folk: italian > folk,
        ["Nationality:italian", "Music:folk"]
    )

    # Clue 4: the person who plays tennis is the same person as the nigerian person
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda tennis, nigerian: tennis == nigerian,
        ["Sport:tennis", "Nationality:nigerian"]
    )

    solutions = problem.getSolutions()

    if not solutions:
        return None

    if len(solutions) > 1:
        raise ValueError("Multiple solutions found")

    solution = solutions[0]

    result_dict = {category: [""] * num_positions for category in categories}
    for category in categories:
        for item in items[category]:
            pos = solution[f"{category}:{item}"]
            result_dict[category][pos] = item

    print(result_dict)

solve_einstein_puzzle()

Your task is to determine which attributes belong to which person based on the given clues. The clues describe relationships between people and their attributes. 4. Hobby: fishing, magic-tricks, photography, hiking, board-games

Each category has exactly 5 items, and no item repeats within a category.

Clues:

1. the person who likes blueberry and the person who enjoys hiking are at positions with different parity (one at odd, one at even position)
2. the person who has horse as a pet is at the same position as or to the right of the person who uses taxi for transportation
3. the person who likes pineapple and the person who has guinea-pig as a pet are at positions with different parity (one at odd, one at even position)
4. the person who uses scooter for transportation is adjacent to the person who uses van for transportation (either immediately left or right)
5. the person who likes coffee is to the left of the person who likes pineapple (not necessarily immediately)
6. the person who enjoys hiking is a different person than the person who likes soy-milk
7. the person who likes pineapple is at the same position as or to the left of the person who uses taxi for transportation
8. the person who likes juice is a different person than the person who uses taxi for transportation
9. the person who enjoys hiking and the person who uses scooter for transportation are at positions with different parity (one at odd, one at even position)
10. the person who uses roller for transportation is adjacent to the person who likes tea (either immediately left or right)
11. the person who uses van for transportation is to the right of the person who enjoys fishing (not necessarily immediately)
12. the person who has guinea-pig as a pet is the same person as exactly one of the person who enjoys hiking or the person who likes eggplant
13. the person who enjoys magic-tricks is to the right of the person who likes soy-milk (not necessarily immediately)
14. the person who likes mango is at the same position as or to the left of the person who uses taxi for transportation
15. the person who has fish as a pet and the person who enjoys fishing are at positions with the same parity (both at odd or both at even positions)
16. the person who uses roller for transportation is to the left of the person who uses quad-bike for transportation (not necessarily immediately)
17. the person who has hedgehog as a pet is adjacent to the person who has guinea-pig as a pet (either immediately left or right)
18. the person who uses scooter for transportation is to the right of the person who enjoys photography (not necessarily immediately)
19. the person who uses taxi for transportation is to the right of the person who likes water (not necessarily immediately)
20. the person who likes eggplant is adjacent to the person who likes lemon (either immediately left or right)

Expected Output Format:

Your solution should be a dictionary where:
- Each key is a category name (e.g., "Beverage", "Food").
- Each value is a list of items, ordered by position from left to right (position 1 to position 5).
- Each item in a category must appear exactly once.
rationale:
from constraint import Problem, AllDifferentConstraint

def solve_einstein_puzzle():
    problem = Problem()
    num_positions = 5

    categories = ["Beverage", "Transport", "Pet", "Hobby", "Food"]
    items = {
        "Beverage": ["tea", "coffee", "water", "juice", "soy-milk"],
        "Transport": ["van", "taxi", "scooter", "roller", "quad-bike"],
        "Pet": ["lizard", "fish", "horse", "guinea-pig", "hedgehog"],
        "Hobby": ["fishing", "magic-tricks", "photography", "hiking", "board-games"],
        "Food": ["eggplant", "blueberry", "mango", "pineapple", "lemon"]
    }

    # Add variables
    for category in categories:
        for item in items[category]:
            var = f"{category}:{item}"
            problem.addVariable(var, range(num_positions))

    # All items in same category must be in different positions
    for category in categories:
        vars_in_category = [f"{category}:{item}" for item in items[category]]
        problem.addConstraint(AllDifferentConstraint(), vars_in_category)

    # Clue 1: blueberry and hiking different parity
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda blueberry, hiking: blueberry % 2 != hiking % 2,
        ["Food:blueberry", "Hobby:hiking"]
    )

    # Clue 2: horse same or to right of taxi
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda horse, taxi: horse >= taxi,
        ["Pet:horse", "Transport:taxi"]
    )

    # Clue 3: pineapple and guinea-pig different parity
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda pineapple, guinea_pig: pineapple % 2 != guinea_pig % 2,
        ["Food:pineapple", "Pet:guinea-pig"]
    )

    # Clue 4: scooter adjacent to van
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda scooter, van: abs(scooter - van) == 1,
        ["Transport:scooter", "Transport:van"]
    )

    # Clue 5: coffee to left of pineapple
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda coffee, pineapple: coffee < pineapple,
        ["Beverage:coffee", "Food:pineapple"]
    )

    # Clue 6: hiking different person than soy-milk
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda hiking, soy_milk: hiking != soy_milk,
        ["Hobby:hiking", "Beverage:soy-milk"]
    )

    # Clue 7: pineapple same or to left of taxi
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda pineapple, taxi: pineapple <= taxi,
        ["Food:pineapple", "Transport:taxi"]
    )

    # Clue 8: juice different person than taxi
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda juice, taxi: juice != taxi,
        ["Beverage:juice", "Transport:taxi"]
    )

    # Clue 9: hiking and scooter different parity
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda hiking, scooter: hiking % 2 != scooter % 2,
        ["Hobby:hiking", "Transport:scooter"]
    )

    # Clue 10: roller adjacent to tea
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda roller, tea: abs(roller - tea) == 1,
        ["Transport:roller", "Beverage:tea"]
    )

    # Clue 11: van to right of fishing
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda van, fishing: van > fishing,
        ["Transport:van", "Hobby:fishing"]
    )

    # Clue 12: guinea-pig same as exactly one of hiking or eggplant
    # This means guinea-pig is either hiking or eggplant but not both.
    def guinea_pig_one_of(hiking, eggplant, guinea_pig):
        count = 0
        if hiking == guinea_pig:
            count += 1
        if eggplant == guinea_pig:
            count += 1
        return count == 1
    problem.addConstraint(
        guinea_pig_one_of,
        ["Hobby:hiking", "Food:eggplant", "Pet:guinea-pig"]
    )

    # Clue 13: magic-tricks to right of soy-milk
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda magic_tricks, soy_milk: magic_tricks > soy_milk,
        ["Hobby:magic-tricks", "Beverage:soy-milk"]
    )

    # Clue 14: mango same or to left of taxi
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda mango, taxi: mango <= taxi,
        ["Food:mango", "Transport:taxi"]
    )

    # Clue 15: fish and fishing same parity
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda fish, fishing: fish % 2 == fishing % 2,
        ["Pet:fish", "Hobby:fishing"]
    )

    # Clue 16: roller to left of quad-bike
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda roller, quad_bike: roller < quad_bike,
        ["Transport:roller", "Transport:quad-bike"]
    )

    # Clue 17: hedgehog adjacent to guinea-pig
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda hedgehog, guinea_pig: abs(hedgehog - guinea_pig) == 1,
        ["Pet:hedgehog", "Pet:guinea-pig"]
    )

    # Clue 18: scooter to right of photography
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda scooter, photography: scooter > photography,
        ["Transport:scooter", "Hobby:photography"]
    )

    # Clue 19: taxi to right of water
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda taxi, water: taxi > water,
        ["Transport:taxi", "Beverage:water"]
    )

    # Clue 20: eggplant adjacent to lemon
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda eggplant, lemon: abs(eggplant - lemon) == 1,
        ["Food:eggplant", "Food:lemon"]
    )

    solutions = problem.getSolutions()

    if not solutions:
        return None

    if len(solutions) > 1:
        # If multiple solutions, pick the first one
        solution = solutions[0]
    else:
        solution = solutions[0]

    # Format output
    result = {}
    for category in categories:
        result[category] = [""] * num_positions
        for item in items[category]:
            var = f"{category}:{item}"
            pos = solution[var]
            result[category][pos] = item

    print(result)

solve_einstein_puzzle()

question:
You are given an Einstein logic puzzle. In this puzzle, there are 5 people living in the same community. Each person has exactly one attribute from each of 3 different categories (like nationality, pet, drink, etc.). No two people share the same attribute from any category. Your task is to determine which attributes belong to which person based on the given clues. The clues describe relationships between people and their attributes. For example 'the person with the red house is immediately to the left of the person who drinks coffee'. By logically combining all clues, you should be able to determine the complete solution.

Setup:

The puzzle involves the following categories, each with 5 unique items:

1. Movie: scientific, crime, epic, thriller, horror
2. Nationality: british, pakistani, australian, russian, canadian
3. Pet: frog, mouse, chinchilla, lizard, horse

Each category has exactly 5 items, and no item repeats within a category.

Clues:

1. the pakistani person is at an end position (either leftmost or rightmost)
2. the person who likes horror movies is the same person as the person who has lizard as a pet
3. the person who likes crime movies is somewhere between the british person and the person who likes scientific movies (not necessarily immediately adjacent)
4. the pakistani person is immediately to the right of the person who likes horror movies
5. the person who has chinchilla as a pet is to the left of the british person (not necessarily immediately)
6. the canadian person is the same person as the person who likes horror movies
7. the person who has horse as a pet is immediately to the right of the canadian person
8. the person who has frog as a pet is to the left of the russian person (not necessarily immediately)
9. 0 is at position 5

Expected Output Format:

Your solution should be a dictionary where:
- Each key is a category name (e.g., "Movie", "Nationality").
- Each value is a list of items, ordered by position from left to right (position 1 to position 5).
- Each item in a category must appear exactly once.
rationale:
from constraint import Problem, AllDifferentConstraint

def solve_einstein_puzzle():
    problem = Problem()
    num_positions = 5

    categories = ["Movie", "Nationality", "Pet"]
    items = {
        "Movie": ["scientific", "crime", "epic", "thriller", "horror"],
        "Nationality": ["british", "pakistani", "australian", "russian", "canadian"],
        "Pet": ["frog", "mouse", "chinchilla", "lizard", "horse"]
    }

    # Add variables
    for category in categories:
        for item in items[category]:
            var = f"{category}:{item}"
            problem.addVariable(var, range(num_positions))

    # All items in the same category must be at different positions
    for category in categories:
        vars_in_cat = [f"{category}:{item}" for item in items[category]]
        problem.addConstraint(AllDifferentConstraint(), vars_in_cat)

    # Clue 1: the pakistani person is at an end position (0 or 4)
    problem.addConstraint(lambda pakistani: pakistani == 0 or pakistani == 4, ["Nationality:pakistani"])

    # Clue 2: the person who likes horror movies is the same person as the person who has lizard as a pet
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda horror, lizard: horror == lizard,
        ["Movie:horror", "Pet:lizard"]
    )

    # Clue 3: the person who likes crime movies is somewhere between the british person and the person who likes scientific movies
    # That means: british < crime < scientific or scientific < crime < british
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda british, crime, scientific: (british < crime < scientific) or (scientific < crime < british),
        ["Nationality:british", "Movie:crime", "Movie:scientific"]
    )

    # Clue 4: the pakistani person is immediately to the right of the person who likes horror movies
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda pakistani, horror: pakistani == horror + 1,
        ["Nationality:pakistani", "Movie:horror"]
    )

    # Clue 5: the person who has chinchilla as a pet is to the left of the british person (not necessarily immediately)
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda chinchilla, british: chinchilla < british,
        ["Pet:chinchilla", "Nationality:british"]
    )

    # Clue 6: the canadian person is the same person as the person who likes horror movies
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda canadian, horror: canadian == horror,
        ["Nationality:canadian", "Movie:horror"]
    )

    # Clue 7: the person who has horse as a pet is immediately to the right of the canadian person
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda horse, canadian: horse == canadian + 1,
        ["Pet:horse", "Nationality:canadian"]
    )

    # Clue 8: the person who has frog as a pet is to the left of the russian person (not necessarily immediately)
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda frog, russian: frog < russian,
        ["Pet:frog", "Nationality:russian"]
    )

    # Clue 9: 0 is at position 5
    # The clue is ambiguous as stated, but presumably means the item '0' at position 5.
    # Since no category/item named '0' exists, we ignore this clue as irrelevant or a typo.
    # If it means position index 4 (position 5) is assigned to some item '0', no such item exists.
    # So ignore this clue.

    # Solve
    solutions = problem.getSolutions()

    if not solutions:
        return None

    if len(solutions) > 1:
        # Pick first solution anyway
        solution = solutions[0]
    else:
        solution = solutions[0]

    # Format output dictionary
    result = {category: [""] * num_positions for category in categories}
    for category in categories:
        for item in items[category]:
            var = f"{category}:{item}"
            pos = solution[var]
            result[category][pos] = item

    print(result)

solve_einstein_puzzle()

17. the person who likes carrot is to the right of the person who enjoys video-games (not necessarily immediately)
18. the person who likes soy-milk is at the same position as or to the left of the person who likes documentary movies
19. the person who likes kale is a different person than the person who likes water
20. the person who likes soy-milk is at the same position as or to the left of the person who likes coffee
21. the person who enjoys skydiving and the person who likes kale are at positions with the same parity (both at odd or both at even positions)

26. the person who likes tea is at the same position as or to the right of the person who enjoys singing
27. the american person is to the left of the person who likes kale (not necessarily immediately)

Expected Output Format:

Your solution should be a dictionary where:
- Each key is a category name (e.g., "Beverage", "Food").
- Each value is a list of items, ordered by position from left to right (position 1 to position 5).

from constraint import Problem, AllDifferentConstraint

def solve_einstein_puzzle():
    problem = Problem()
    num_positions = 5

    categories = ["Nationality", "Food", "Beverage", "Movie", "Hobby"]
    items = {
        "Nationality": ["japanese", "american", "german", "mexican", "spanish"],
        "Food": ["kale", "peas", "kiwi", "apple", "carrot"],
        "Beverage": ["tea", "coffee", "water", "soy-milk", "iced-tea"],
        "Movie": ["drama", "musical", "martial-arts", "epic", "documentary"],
        "Hobby": ["baking", "singing", "rock-climbing", "video-games", "skydiving"]
    }

    # Add variables for each item with domain 0..4 (positions)
    for category in categories:
        for item in items[category]:
            variable_name = f"{category}:{item}"
            problem.addVariable(variable_name, range(num_positions))

    # All items in same category must have different positions
    for category in categories:
        vars_in_cat = [f"{category}:{item}" for item in items[category]]
        problem.addConstraint(AllDifferentConstraint(), vars_in_cat)

    # Clue 1: musical movies same or right of documentary movies
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda musical, documentary: musical >= documentary,
        ["Movie:musical", "Movie:documentary"]
    )

    # Clue 2: video-games same or left of rock-climbing
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda video_games, rock_climbing: video_games <= rock_climbing,
        ["Hobby:video-games", "Hobby:rock-climbing"]
    )

    # Clue 3: martial-arts same as video-games or kiwi
    def martial_arts_constraint(martial_arts, video_games, kiwi):
        return martial_arts == video_games or martial_arts == kiwi
    problem.addConstraint(
        martial_arts_constraint,
        ["Movie:martial-arts", "Hobby:video-games", "Food:kiwi"]
    )

    # Clue 4: skydiving left of kiwi
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda skydiving, kiwi: skydiving < kiwi,
        ["Hobby:skydiving", "Food:kiwi"]
    )

    # Clue 5: documentary left of kale
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda documentary, kale: documentary < kale,
        ["Movie:documentary", "Food:kale"]
    )

    # Clue 6: coffee and epic same parity
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda coffee, epic: (coffee % 2) == (epic % 2),
        ["Beverage:coffee", "Movie:epic"]
    )

    # Clue 7: mexican left of japanese
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda mexican, japanese: mexican < japanese,
        ["Nationality:mexican", "Nationality:japanese"]
    )

    # Clue 8: skydiving between iced-tea and kiwi (not necessarily adjacent)
    def between_constraint(skydiving, iced_tea, kiwi):
        return (iced_tea < skydiving < kiwi) or (kiwi < skydiving < iced_tea)
    problem.addConstraint(
        between_constraint,
        ["Hobby:skydiving", "Beverage:iced-tea", "Food:kiwi"]
    )

    # Clue 9: spanish same as iced-tea or apple
    def spanish_constraint(spanish, iced_tea, apple):
        return spanish == iced_tea or spanish == apple
    problem.addConstraint(
        spanish_constraint,
        ["Nationality:spanish", "Beverage:iced-tea", "Food:apple"]
    )

    # Clue 10: mexican same or left of singing
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda mexican, singing: mexican <= singing,
        ["Nationality:mexican", "Hobby:singing"]
    )

    # Clue 11: spanish different from drama or drama different from coffee or both
    def clue11(spanish, drama, coffee):
        return spanish != drama or drama != coffee
    problem.addConstraint(
        clue11,
        ["Nationality:spanish", "Movie:drama", "Beverage:coffee"]
    )

    # Clue 12: mexican and musical same parity
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda mexican, musical: (mexican % 2) == (musical % 2),
        ["Nationality:mexican", "Movie:musical"]
    )

    # Clue 13: rock-climbing and kale same parity
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda rock_climbing, kale: (rock_climbing % 2) == (kale % 2),
        ["Hobby:rock-climbing", "Food:kale"]
    )

    # Clue 14: rock-climbing same as american or apple
    def clue14(rock_climbing, american, apple):
        return rock_climbing == american or rock_climbing == apple
    problem.addConstraint(
        clue14,
        ["Hobby:rock-climbing", "Nationality:american", "Food:apple"]
    )

    # Clue 15: musical same or left of water
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda musical, water: musical <= water,
        ["Movie:musical", "Beverage:water"]
    )

    # Clue 16: carrot right of german
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda carrot, german: carrot > german,
        ["Food:carrot", "Nationality:german"]
    )

    # Clue 17: carrot right of video-games
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda carrot, video_games: carrot > video_games,
        ["Food:carrot", "Hobby:video-games"]
    )

    # Clue 18: soy-milk same or left of documentary
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda soy_milk, documentary: soy_milk <= documentary,
        ["Beverage:soy-milk", "Movie:documentary"]
    )

    # Clue 19: kale different from water
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda kale, water: kale != water,
        ["Food:kale", "Beverage:water"]
    )

    # Clue 20: soy-milk same or left of coffee
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda soy_milk, coffee: soy_milk <= coffee,
        ["Beverage:soy-milk", "Beverage:coffee"]
    )

    # Clue 21: skydiving and kale same parity
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda skydiving, kale: (skydiving % 2) == (kale % 2),
        ["Hobby:skydiving", "Food:kale"]
    )

    # Clue 22: video-games left of kale
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda video_games, kale: video_games < kale,
        ["Hobby:video-games", "Food:kale"]
    )

    # Clue 23: japanese different from peas
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda japanese, peas: japanese != peas,
        ["Nationality:japanese", "Food:peas"]
    )

    # Clue 24: spanish right of rock-climbing
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda spanish, rock_climbing: spanish > rock_climbing,
        ["Nationality:spanish", "Hobby:rock-climbing"]
    )

    # Clue 25: carrot left of water
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda carrot, water: carrot < water,
        ["Food:carrot", "Beverage:water"]
    )

    # Clue 26: tea same or right of singing
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda tea, singing: tea >= singing,
        ["Beverage:tea", "Hobby:singing"]
    )

    # Clue 27: american left of kale
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda american, kale: american < kale,
        ["Nationality:american", "Food:kale"]
    )

    solutions = problem.getSolutions()

    if not solutions:
        return None

    if len(solutions) > 1:
        raise ValueError("Multiple solutions found")

    solution = solutions[0]

    result_dict = {}
    for category in categories:
        result_dict[category] = [""] * num_positions

    for category in categories:
        for item in items[category]:
            var = f"{category}:{item}"
            pos = solution[var]
            result_dict[category][pos] = item

    print(result_dict)

solve_einstein_puzzle()

question:
You are given an Einstein logic puzzle. In this puzzle, there are 5 people living in the same community. Each person has exactly one attribute from each of 5 different categories (like nationality, pet, drink, etc.). No two people share the same attribute from any category. Your task is to determine which attributes belong to which person based on the given clues. The clues describe relationships between people and their attributes. For example 'the person with the red house is immediately to the left of the person who drinks coffee'. By logically combining all clues, you should be able to determine the complete solution.

Setup:

The puzzle involves the following categories, each with 5 unique items:

1. Beverage: juice, milk, hot-chocolate, tea, iced-tea
2. Nationality: italian, mexican, turkish, russian, indian
3. Sport: snowboarding, handball, basketball, skiing, badminton
4. Transport: scooter, taxi, subway, trike, bus
5. Hobby: magic-tricks, card-games, traveling, skydiving, reading

Each category has exactly 5 items, and no item repeats within a category.

Clues:

1. the person who plays handball and the person who likes hot-chocolate are at positions with different parity (one at odd, one at even position)
2. the person who uses trike for transportation is adjacent to the person who plays badminton (either immediately left or right)
3. the person who enjoys magic-tricks is the same person as the italian person
4. the person who uses subway for transportation is at the same position as or to the right of the person who likes milk
5. the person who uses scooter for transportation is immediately to the right of the person who plays skiing
6. the turkish person is adjacent to the person who enjoys card-games (either immediately left or right)
7. the person who plays basketball is immediately to the left of the russian person
8. the person who likes hot-chocolate is the same person as the person who enjoys reading
9. the person who enjoys skydiving and the italian person are at positions with different parity (one at odd, one at even position)
10. the indian person is immediately to the right of the russian person
11. the person who plays skiing is to the right of the indian person (not necessarily immediately)
12. the person who likes juice is to the left of the person who likes iced-tea (not necessarily immediately)
13. the person who likes iced-tea is adjacent to the person who likes milk (either immediately left or right)
14. the person who enjoys magic-tricks is immediately to the right of the person who uses taxi for transportation
15. the person who enjoys traveling is immediately to the right of the person who uses bus for transportation

Expected Output Format:

Your solution should be a dictionary where:
- Each key is a category name (e.g., "Beverage", "Hobby").
- Each value is a list of items, ordered by position from left to right (position 1 to position 5).
- Each item in a category must appear exactly once.
rationale:
from constraint import Problem, AllDifferentConstraint

def solve_einstein_puzzle():
    problem = Problem()
    num_positions = 5

    categories = ["Beverage", "Nationality", "Sport", "Transport", "Hobby"]
    items = {
        "Beverage": ["juice", "milk", "hot-chocolate", "tea", "iced-tea"],
        "Nationality": ["italian", "mexican", "turkish", "russian", "indian"],
        "Sport": ["snowboarding", "handball", "basketball", "skiing", "badminton"],
        "Transport": ["scooter", "taxi", "subway", "trike", "bus"],
        "Hobby": ["magic-tricks", "card-games", "traveling", "skydiving", "reading"]
    }

    # Add variables
    for category in categories:
        for item in items[category]:
            problem.addVariable(f"{category}:{item}", range(num_positions))

    # All items in same category must be at different positions
    for category in categories:
        problem.addConstraint(AllDifferentConstraint(), [f"{category}:{item}" for item in items[category]])

    # Clue 1: handball and hot-chocolate are at positions with different parity
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda handball, hot_chocolate: (handball % 2) != (hot_chocolate % 2),
        ["Sport:handball", "Beverage:hot-chocolate"]
    )

    # Clue 2: trike adjacent to badminton
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda trike, badminton: abs(trike - badminton) == 1,
        ["Transport:trike", "Sport:badminton"]
    )

    # Clue 3: magic-tricks same person as italian
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda magic_tricks, italian: magic_tricks == italian,
        ["Hobby:magic-tricks", "Nationality:italian"]
    )

    # Clue 4: subway same position as or to the right of milk
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda subway, milk: subway >= milk,
        ["Transport:subway", "Beverage:milk"]
    )

    # Clue 5: scooter immediately to right of skiing
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda scooter, skiing: scooter == skiing + 1,
        ["Transport:scooter", "Sport:skiing"]
    )

    # Clue 6: turkish adjacent to card-games
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda turkish, card_games: abs(turkish - card_games) == 1,
        ["Nationality:turkish", "Hobby:card-games"]
    )

    # Clue 7: basketball immediately to left of russian
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda basketball, russian: basketball == russian - 1,
        ["Sport:basketball", "Nationality:russian"]
    )

    # Clue 8: hot-chocolate same person as reading
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda hot_chocolate, reading: hot_chocolate == reading,
        ["Beverage:hot-chocolate", "Hobby:reading"]
    )

    # Clue 9: skydiving and italian at positions with different parity
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda skydiving, italian: (skydiving % 2) != (italian % 2),
        ["Hobby:skydiving", "Nationality:italian"]
    )

    # Clue 10: indian immediately to right of russian
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda indian, russian: indian == russian + 1,
        ["Nationality:indian", "Nationality:russian"]
    )

    # Clue 11: skiing to right of indian (not necessarily immediately)
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda skiing, indian: skiing > indian,
        ["Sport:skiing", "Nationality:indian"]
    )

    # Clue 12: juice to left of iced-tea (not necessarily immediately)
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda juice, iced_tea: juice < iced_tea,
        ["Beverage:juice", "Beverage:iced-tea"]
    )

    # Clue 13: iced-tea adjacent to milk
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda iced_tea, milk: abs(iced_tea - milk) == 1,
        ["Beverage:iced-tea", "Beverage:milk"]
    )

    # Clue 14: magic-tricks immediately to right of taxi
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda magic_tricks, taxi: magic_tricks == taxi + 1,
        ["Hobby:magic-tricks", "Transport:taxi"]
    )

    # Clue 15: traveling immediately to right of bus
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda traveling, bus: traveling == bus + 1,
        ["Hobby:traveling", "Transport:bus"]
    )

    solutions = problem.getSolutions()

    if not solutions:
        return None

    if len(solutions) > 1:
        # If multiple solutions, raise error
        raise ValueError("Multiple solutions found")

    solution = solutions[0]

    result_dict = {}
    for category in categories:
        result_dict[category] = [""] * num_positions

    for category in categories:
        for item in items[category]:
            pos = solution[f"{category}:{item}"]
            result_dict[category][pos] = item

    print(result_dict)

solve_einstein_puzzle()

question:
You are given an Einstein logic puzzle. In this puzzle, there are 4 people living in the same community. Each person has exactly one attribute from each of 2 different categories (like nationality, pet, drink, etc.). No two people share the same attribute from any category. Your task is to determine which attributes belong to which person based on the given clues. The clues describe relationships between people and their attributes. For example 'the person with the red house is immediately to the left of the person who drinks coffee'. By logically combining all clues, you should be able to determine the complete solution.

Setup:

The puzzle involves the following categories, each with 4 unique items:

1. Food: grapes, papaya, grapefruit, nectarine
2. Hobby: baking, gardening, rock-climbing, collecting

Each category has exactly 4 items, and no item repeats within a category.

Clues:

1. the person who enjoys baking is immediately to the left of the person who enjoys rock-climbing
2. the person who likes grapes is immediately to the left of the person who likes nectarine
3. the person who enjoys collecting is the same person as the person who likes grapefruit
4. the person who enjoys baking is at position 1 (the leftmost position)
5. the person who likes nectarine is adjacent to the person who enjoys gardening (either immediately left or right)

Expected Output Format:

Your solution should be a dictionary where:
- Each key is a category name (e.g., "Food", "Hobby").
- Each value is a list of items, ordered by position from left to right (position 1 to position 4).
- Each item in a category must appear exactly once.
rationale:
from constraint import Problem, AllDifferentConstraint

def solve_einstein_puzzle():
    problem = Problem()
    num_positions = 4

    categories = ["Food", "Hobby"]
    items = {
        "Food": ["grapes", "papaya", "grapefruit", "nectarine"],
        "Hobby": ["baking", "gardening", "rock-climbing", "collecting"]
    }

    # Add variables for each item with domain being the possible positions
    for category in categories:
        for item in items[category]:
            variable_name = f"{category}:{item}"
            problem.addVariable(variable_name, range(num_positions))

    # All items in the same category must be at different positions
    for category in categories:
        category_items = [f"{category}:{item}" for item in items[category]]
        problem.addConstraint(AllDifferentConstraint(), category_items)

    # Clue 1: baking is immediately to the left of rock-climbing
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda baking, rock_climbing: baking == rock_climbing - 1,
        ["Hobby:baking", "Hobby:rock-climbing"]
    )

    # Clue 2: grapes is immediately to the left of nectarine
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda grapes, nectarine: grapes == nectarine - 1,
        ["Food:grapes", "Food:nectarine"]
    )

    # Clue 3: collecting is the same person as grapefruit
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda collecting, grapefruit: collecting == grapefruit,
        ["Hobby:collecting", "Food:grapefruit"]
    )

    # Clue 4: baking is at position 1 (leftmost, index 0)
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda baking: baking == 0,
        ["Hobby:baking"]
    )

    # Clue 5: nectarine is adjacent to gardening
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda nectarine, gardening: abs(nectarine - gardening) == 1,
        ["Food:nectarine", "Hobby:gardening"]
    )

    solutions = problem.getSolutions()

    if not solutions:
        return None

    if len(solutions) > 1:
        raise ValueError("Multiple solutions found")

    solution = solutions[0]

    result_dict = {}
    for category in categories:
        result_dict[category] = [""] * num_positions

    for category in categories:
        for item in items[category]:
            var = f"{category}:{item}"
            pos = solution[var]
            result_dict[category][pos] = item

    print(result_dict)

solve_einstein_puzzle()

from constraint import Problem, AllDifferentConstraint

def solve_einstein_puzzle():
    problem = Problem()
    num_positions = 4

    categories = ["Transport", "Music", "Nationality", "Hobby", "Job"]
    items = {
        "Transport": ["skateboard", "ship", "airplane", "bike"],
        "Music": ["gospel", "punk", "jazz", "indie"],
        "Nationality": ["nigerian", "indian", "spanish", "turkish"],
        "Hobby": ["dancing", "camping", "gardening", "skydiving"],
        "Job": ["fisherman", "architect", "accountant", "social-worker"]
    }

    # Add variables for each item
    for category in categories:
        for item in items[category]:
            variable_name = f"{category}:{item}"
            problem.addVariable(variable_name, range(num_positions))

    # All items in the same category must occupy different positions
    for category in categories:
        vars_in_cat = [f"{category}:{item}" for item in items[category]]
        problem.addConstraint(AllDifferentConstraint(), vars_in_cat)

    # Clue 1:
    # The person who enjoys gardening is the same person as exactly one of the turkish person or the person who works as a social-worker
    # i.e. gardening == turkish xor gardening == social-worker
    def clue1(gardening, turkish, social_worker):
        return (gardening == turkish) != (gardening == social_worker)
    problem.addConstraint(clue1,
        ["Hobby:gardening", "Nationality:turkish", "Job:social-worker"])

    # Clue 2:
    # indie music adjacent to accountant
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda indie, accountant: abs(indie - accountant) == 1,
        ["Music:indie", "Job:accountant"]

    # Clue 3:

    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda jazz, airplane: jazz < airplane,
        ["Music:jazz", "Transport:airplane"]

    # architect == bike xor bike == gospel (but not both)
    def clue4(architect, bike, gospel):
        return (architect == bike) != (bike == gospel)
    problem.addConstraint(clue4,
        ["Job:architect", "Transport:bike", "Music:gospel"])

    # Clue 5:
    # indian person and architect have same parity
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda indian, architect: (indian % 2) == (architect % 2),
        ["Nationality:indian", "Job:architect"]
    )

    # Clue 6:
    # indian person at an end position (0 or 3)
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda indian: indian == 0 or indian == num_positions - 1,
        ["Nationality:indian"]
    )

    # Clue 7:
    # accountant == (airplane xor indian)
    def clue7(accountant, airplane, indian):
        return (accountant == airplane) != (accountant == indian)
    problem.addConstraint(clue7,
        ["Job:accountant", "Transport:airplane", "Nationality:indian"])

    # Clue 8:
    # nigerian person to the left of jazz music
    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda nigerian, jazz: nigerian < jazz,

    )

    # Clue 9:

    problem.addConstraint(
        lambda gardening, skydiving: gardening == skydiving + 1,

    # Clue 10:

    problem.addConstraint(

    # Clue 11:
